p: EOs obtained from needles of P. heldreichii, P. peuce and P. mugo reduced the secretion of the pro-inflammatory cytokine IL-6 by at least 35% at a concentration of 0.001%, while the oils obtained from twigs of these three Pinus spp. and the cones of P. mugo decreased the secretion of IL-6 by at least 60% at a concentration of 0.01% for the oils obtained from twigs and 0.05% for the cones oils ( Figure 1). IC 50 values were determined with the needles EOs of P. heldreichii and P. mugo showing the lowest IC 50 (0.0002), followed by P. peuce needles and twigs oils (>0.0005). EOs obtained from twigs of P. heldreichii and P. mugo showed an IC 50 of >0.004 and the oils of cones of P. mugo had an IC 50 of 0.02 ( Table 2).
